question:
You have lost an item of value on a train.
Write a letter to the railway company. In your letter


    describe the item
    explain where and when you left it
    say what action you would like the company to take
text: I lost my laptop on a train. It was a MacBook Pro grey colour. Top-secret documents from the UK Military agency were saved on HDD this computer because you can recognise it by a large label with the text "TOP SECRET". This item is very important to me, my mother presented it on my birthday.
I went from London to Bristol on the morning train and was sitting next to the window at place 10, carriage 5. I think I left the laptop when my station was announced and I was hurrying to the city.

Would you be kind enough to look for my notebook computer?  I can assume that the train conductor could see my computer. I strongly advise you to ask him. If he doesn't know you can ask the employee at the Bristol railway station. If you find my laptop, please call or text me.
